text: The Bronswik Affair () is a Canadian short film, directed by Robert Awad and André Leduc and released in 1978.Michel Coulombe and Marcel Jean, Le dictionnaire du cinéma québécois. Boréal, 1988. p. 19. An animated mockumentary, the film satirizes advertising and marketing through the story of Bronswik, a fictional manufacturer of television sets which feature special technology designed to disable viewers' ability to resist advertising pitches, spawning a frenzied addiction to consumerism which leads to a political and social crisis."Short Film Reviews: L'Affaire Bronswik". Cinema Canada, March 1979. pp. 38-39. The film won the Canadian Film Award for Best Theatrical Short Film at the 29th Canadian Film Awards.Maria Topalovich, And the Genie Goes To...: Celebrating 50 Years of the Canadian Film Awards.
